author: William Shakespeare
text: A rose by any other name would smell as sweet.

author: William Shakespeare
text: All that glitters is not gold.

author: William Shakespeare
text: All the world’s a stage, and all the men and women merely players.

author: John Kennedy
text: Ask not what your country can do for you; ask what you can do for your country.

author: the Bible
text: Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and you shall find.

author: Woody Allen
text: Eighty percent of success is showing up.

author: Sherlock Holmes (character)
text: Elementary, my dear Watson.

author: the Bible
text: For those to whom much is given, much is required.

author: Rhett Butler (character)
text: Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn.

author: Thomas Edison
text: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.

author: Harry Callahan (character)
text: Go ahead, make my day.

author: Rudyard Kipling
text: He travels the fastest who travels alone.

author: William Congreve
text: Hell has no fury like a woman scorned.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
text: Hell is other people.

author: Rick Blaine (character)
text: Here's looking at you, kid.

author: Jim Lovell (character)
text: Houston, we have a problem.

author: Martin Luther King
text: I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character.

author: Blanche Dubois (character)
text: I have always depended on the kindness of strangers.

author: Lt. Kilgore (character)
text: I love the smell of napalm in the morning.

author: Rene Descartes
text: I think therefore I am.

author: W. E. Hickson
text: If at first you don’t succeed, try, try again.

author: Winston Churchill
text: If you are going through hell, keep going.

author: Joe Jackson (character)
text: If you build it, they will come.

author: Charles-Guillaume Étienne
text: If you want something done right, do it yourself.

author: Margaret Thatcher
text: If you want something said, ask a man; if you want something done, ask a woman.

author: Terminator (character)
text: I'll be back.

author: Vito Corleone (character)
text: I'm gonna make him an offer he can't refuse.

author: Dorothy (character)
text: I've got a feeling we're not in Kansas anymo.

author: Michael Corleone (character)
text: Keep your friends close, but your enemies closer.

author: Sir Francis Bacon
text: Knowledge is power.

author: Forrest Gump (character)
text: Life is like a box of chocolates. You never know what you’re gonna get.

author: Albert Einstein
text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.

author: Star Wars (many characters)
text: May the Force be with you.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.

author: J. R. R. Tolkein
text: Not all those who wander are lost.

author: Benjamin Franklin
text: Nothing is certain except for death and taxes.

author: William Shakespeare
text: Parting is such sweet sorrow.

author: John Dalberg-Acton
text: Power corrupts; absolute power corrupts absolutely.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
text: Speak softly and carry a big stick.

author: Neil Armstrong
text: That’s one small step for a man, a giant leap for mankind.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.

author: Dorothy (character)
text: There's no place like home.

author: Benjamin Franklin
text: Three can keep a secret, if two of them are dead.
